Question: Which of these events occurs about every three months?

Choices:
A: high tide
B: new moon
C: new season
D: solar eclipse
steps: To determine which event occurs about every three months, I need to assess the frequency of the events listed in the choices.
High tides occur at least twice daily, so they do not fit the three-month interval.
New moons occur approximately once a month, which also does not match the three-month cycle.
Seasons change about every three months (roughly every season lasts three months), so this event fits the criteria.
Solar eclipses do not have a set frequency; they can occur multiple times a year or not at all for several years, so they do not occur reliably every three months.
